Travelling to Al-Suwayda

In this page you can find every information for a holiday in Al-Suwayda, a pretty good destination in Syria (all info about the whole country here).

We will answer the most important questions: what to visit, when to go, how to get to Al-Suwayda and what means of transport to use to get around. We will describe typical foods, the costs for tourists and where to find accomodation. We will list also the places to see around Al-Suwayda, and we will also talk about safety and how each type of traveler can enjoy a trip here.

So, if you are travelling through Syria, here's everything to know about Al-Suwayda for a perfect holiday.

General info for a trip to Al-Suwayda

Al-Suwayda is a city in southern Syria, located about 100 kilometers from the capital, Damascus. It is the provincial capital of the Al-Suwayda Governorate. The city has a population of approximately 100,000 people. The area is known for its mountainous landscape, ancient ruins, and diverse religious communities, including Sunni Muslims, Christians, and Druze people. The city is considered relatively safe and is an important agricultural center, producing grapes, olives, and other crops. Tourists can visit historic sites, such as the Roman amphitheater and the Shrine of Abu Ibrahim, or explore the stunning natural scenery in the surrounding area.

What to visit in Al-Suwayda

Here are some of the main tourist attractions in Al-Suwayda, Syria: 1. Al-Rabweh Reserve: This is a nature reserve located between two mountains, Al-Rabweh and Al-Saba'iyah. It is a popular destination for eco-tourists who enjoy hiking, bird watching and camping. The reserve is rich in flora and fauna, including rare desert plants and animals such as the Arabian gazelle and the onager.

2. Tell Sheikh Hassan: This is an archaeological site dating back to the Bronze Age. It consists of a complex of ruins, including a palace, a temple, and a burial ground. Recent excavations have uncovered a treasure trove of artifacts, including pottery, jewelry, and coins.

3. Al-Suwayda Museum: This is a local history museum that showcases the cultural heritage of Al-Suwayda. The museum has several galleries, that display art, artifacts, and other objects of historical significance. Visitors can learn about the city's ancient history, the traditions of the Druze community, and the region's diverse ethnic and religious groups.

4. Jabal al-Arab: This is the highest peak in southern Syria, standing over 1,800 meters tall. It is popular among hikers and offers panoramic views of the surrounding landscape. The area is also known for its scenic orchards and vineyards, where visitors can sample local fruits and wines.

5. Al-Suz Mosque: One of the oldest mosques in Syria, dating back to the Umayyad period. It is known for its architectural beauty and Islamic calligraphy. The mosque is open to visitors but requires appropriate dress and behavior.

6. Qanat al-Aqaba: This is a unique system of underground tunnels and channels that were used for water irrigation dating back to the Roman times. The tunnels are now a popular site to visit for tourists.

Overall, Al-Suwayda has a rich cultural and archaeological history that is worth exploring. Its natural landscapes and beautiful mountains make it great for outdoor activities, and its local food and hospitality offer a great opportunity for visitors to experience Syrian culture first-hand.

In this website, you can find many other destinations to visit in Syria, so you can have a look in the "USEFUL LINKS" sections in this page for other places that could inspire your trip.

When to go on holiday to Al-Suwayda

It is recommended to visit Al-Suwayda (Syria) during the months of spring (March to May) and autumn (September to November) when the temperatures are mild and pleasant. Summer (June to August) can be very hot and dry, with temperatures often exceeding 40 degrees Celsius, while winter (December to February) can be chilly and rainy. Keep in mind that the political situation in Syria is currently unstable and it is important to consult with your government's travel advisory before planning a trip to this destination.

How to get to Al-Suwayda

If you are planning to travel to Al-Suwayda in Syria, the best and safest way to get there is by flying to the Damascus International Airport (DAM). From there, you can take a taxi or bus to Al-Suwayda, which is about 100 km south of Damascus. However, due to the ongoing conflict in Syria, it is important to check the travel advisories and safety information before planning any trip to this area. It is strongly recommended that you contact your local embassy or consulate to ensure you have the appropriate travel documents and understand the current situation before you travel.

Is Al-Suwayda an expensive destination for tourists?

Al-Suwayda is not a very popular destination for tourists and as a result, the cost of accommodations and food is relatively cheap compared to other popular tourist destinations in Syria. However, the overall cost of travel may vary depending on factors such as travel mode, duration of stay, and personal spending choices. It's best to do some research on the specific accommodations, attractions and activities that you plan on experiencing during your stay to get a better understanding of the costs.

Where to find accomodation in Al-Suwayda

The best areas to find accommodation when visiting Al-Suwayda in Syria are the city center and surrounding areas. Some popular areas to consider include Al-Sabil, Al-Magharbeh, Al-Nahda, and Al-Adliyeh. These areas are well-connected and offer a range of accommodation options including hotels, guesthouses, and homes for rent. Additionally, staying in the city center or nearby areas allows easy access to local attractions, shops, and restaurants.

Is Al-Suwayda a safe destination for tourists?

Al-Suwayda is generally considered a safe place for tourists given the relatively calm security situation in the area. However, it is important to note that Syria as a whole has experienced conflict and political instability in recent years, and there may still be some risks associated with travel to the country. It is recommended that you check with your country's foreign travel advisory website for the most up-to-date information before planning a trip to Al-Suwayda or anywhere else in Syria. Additionally, it is always a good idea to exercise caution, stay aware of your surroundings, and follow the advice of local authorities while traveling.

You can find general info about safety for tourists in Syria here. Always check updated government info about travelers's safety on the ufficial Foreign Affairs website of your government, before visiting Al-Suwayda.

What type of travelers will enjoy Al-Suwayda the most?

Al-Suwayda is a great destination for travelers who are interested in history, culture, and natural beauty. It is a city in southwest Syria known for its beautiful landscapes, historical sites, and impressive architecture. Al-Suwayda is suitable for couples and families who want to explore the region's cultural sites, including the ancient Roman village of Shahba, Qanawat Archaeological Site, and the Al-Suwayda Museum. Hiking enthusiasts will also find plenty of opportunities to explore the surrounding mountains, including the impressive Jabal al-Arab. While the city is not known for its nightlife or party scene, it is an excellent destination for those who enjoy a more relaxed pace of travel and want to learn more about Syrian history and culture.

How to get around Al-Suwayda

The most common forms of transportation to move around Al-Suwayda are taxis and mini-buses. Taxis can be found throughout the city and can be hailed on the street. Mini-buses operate on set routes and can be boarded at designated stops. Additionally, rental cars are available for those who prefer to drive themselves. However, it's important to note that driving in Syria can be challenging and is not recommended for inexperienced drivers.
